rgraph

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • rgraph.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Module, Unit

    public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    Node is the class representing a node with a constant number of edges asociated with it.

    In version 1.0 the number of edges is exactly 4.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Node()
      Default node constructor, constructs node with no edges
      Node(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Edge> connections)
      Constructs a node with a given map from direction to edge

      • removeEdge

        public void removeEdge(int dir)
        Removes an edge in a direction.

        If no edge exists, has no effect.

        Parameters:
        dir - Direction of edge to remove

        Returns:

        Given a 2d array finds own coordinate in array.
        Parameters:
        nodes - 2d array of nodes
        Returns:
        2d location of this object in array, (-1,-1) if not found

      • addNeighbor

        public Edge addNeighbor(Node neighbor,
                        int dir,
                        boolean isExtended,
                        boolean isConnected)
        Creates and returns an edge making a neighbor in a relative direction.
        Parameters:
        neighbor - Neighboring node to add edge
        direction - Direction of neighbor relative to self
        isExtended - True if neighbor is far away
        isConnected - True if neighbor is connected
        Returns:
        Edge used in connection

      • hasEdge

        public boolean hasEdge(int dir)
        Returns if edge exists in a direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - direction of interest
        Returns:
        true iff edge exists in direction

      • findNeighborDirection

        public int findNeighborDirection(Node neighbor)
        Given a node, attempts to find the direction to that node in the set {0=North, 1=East, 2=South, 3=West}.
        Parameters:
        neighbor - Neighboring node to find
        Returns:
        direction of neighboring node. If neighbor is not found as a neighbor, returns -1

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Node other)
        Returns true if other node has same id.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true iff nodes are equal.
